description:
Beautiful sisters Ai, Mai, Mii, their android maid Mea and slippery pet ferret Unagi make an amazing journey together through time and space without ever leaving their beloved mansion behind! Following the clues of the strange dandelion-like "Popotan," the girls are theoretically seeking the person who has the answers to their most personal questions, but they seem to have more than enough time to take side trips, meet new friends, visit hot springs and occasionally operate the X-mas shop they keep in the house along the way!

Yet, the girls' ultimate destiny holds more than a few surprises of its own, and not every moment is filled with hilarity, as moving through time means having to leave friends behind as well.

(Source: RightStuf)

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Denpa
tags.description: Works that feature themes of social dissociation, delusions, and other issues like suicide, bullying, self-isolation, paranoia, and technological necessity in daily lives. Classic iconography: telephone poles, rooftops, and trains.

tags.name: Maids
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a maid.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

node.description:
__Associated Names:__ Poyoyon Rock (ぽよよんろっく), Poyoyon♥Rock (ぽよよん♥ろっく), Pucchin Purin

[Twitter (NSFW)](https://twitter.com/punipoyo)

A Japanese animator, character designer, and animation director currently living in Tokyo, Japan. He often goes by the pseudonym Poyoyon Rock.  He is also a member of the doujinshi circle Pokopii.  

(Source: Wikipedia)

Funta is a duo consisting of vocalist/songwriter UCO (U子) and guitarist/keyboardist Yoshimi (吉見). The Funta "sound" can be characterized as having a strong pop rock sensibility with a tendency toward electronic elements and moe-pop vocals.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鶴岡陽太)

Founder and representative director of [Rakuonsha](https://anilist.co/studio/211/).

Studied music composition under the late [Takeo Watanabe](https://anilist.co/staff/106839/).

_Note: Not to be confused with the [famous mangaka](https://anilist.co/staff/96938/)._
Affiliated with [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/).
Freelancer formerly from [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/oitan125) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/花田十輝)

Jukki Hanada is a Japanese screenwriter and novelist. He is the grandson of literary critic and essayist Kiyoteru Hanada. He formerly belonged to [Takao Koyama's](https://anilist.co/staff/117575/Takao-Koyama) Brother Noppo anime scenario house. He's currently affiliated with SATZ.

He's a big fan of professional baseball and supports the Hiroshima Toyo Carp.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/170696565)

Shiotani grew up admiring Ghibli films and Ghost in the Shell, so he decided to enroll in an animation school in order to be able to participate in the creating process of anime. After graduating he joined [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/) becoming one of their most promising young animators. 

After some years spent climbing to the position of animation director on series such as [Windy Tales](https://anilist.co/anime/1524/Windy-Tales/), he left his first creative mark on the industry by directing, storyboarding and supervising [Blood+](https://anilist.co/anime/150/)'s kaleidoscopic 3rd Opening. 

He had his directorial debut with [Tokyo Marble Chocolate](https://anilist.co/anime/3088/), OVA produced as a collaboration between Production I.G. and BMG Japan in commemoration of both companies' 20th anniversaries. The OVA was awarded the Grand Prize in the Feature Film Category of the 12th Seoul International Cartoon & Animation Festival in 2008.

Shiotani is most famous for being the director of the [Psycho-Pass](https://anilist.co/anime/13601/) series. Initially planned with a post-apocalyptic setting, the concept changed after the Great East Japan Earthquake and evolved into its final form. The series is inspired by detective crime stories and sci-fi (Minority Report, Blade Runner, Ghost in the Shell, Patlabor) with the precise intent of exploring societal problems.

Funta is a duo consisting of vocalist/songwriter UCO (U子) and guitarist/keyboardist Yoshimi (吉見). The Funta "sound" can be characterized as having a strong pop rock sensibility with a tendency toward electronic elements and moe-pop vocals.

node.description:
__Introduction:__
UNDER17, alternatively known as Ansebu, was a Japanese musical duo under record label Lantis. They still sometimes collaborate and credit their work together under the name, but have officially announced that band activities ceased years ago.

__Final Members:__
- [Haruko Momoi](https://anilist.co/staff/95258/Haruko-Momoi) (桃井はるこ) – vocalist, in-charge of lyrics
- [Masaya Koike](https://anilist.co/staff/175648/Masaya-Koike) (小池雅也) – guitarist, in-charge of arrangement

**Height:** 160 cm 

[Blog](http://ameblo.jp/momoi-ktkr/) | [Twitter](http://twitter.com/momoiktkr)

__[Profile (ULTRA-PRISM)](http://ultra-prism.com/#team) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/koikemasaya)__

__Masaya Koike__ is a Japanese guitarist, composer and member of musical unit ULTRA-PRISM.

**Height:** 160 cm 

[Blog](http://ameblo.jp/momoi-ktkr/) | [Twitter](http://twitter.com/momoiktkr)

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ronndomizukami)__

__Rondo Mizukami__ is a Japanese animator, character designer and animation director.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/oitan125) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/花田十輝)

Jukki Hanada is a Japanese screenwriter and novelist. He is the grandson of literary critic and essayist Kiyoteru Hanada. He formerly belonged to [Takao Koyama's](https://anilist.co/staff/117575/Takao-Koyama) Brother Noppo anime scenario house. He's currently affiliated with SATZ.

He's a big fan of professional baseball and supports the Hiroshima Toyo Carp.
__Tomoyasu Ookubo__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter, he is also a member of the Writers Guild of Japan.
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/木村暢)
